content:
Based on your BMI and weight status which falls into the obese category, you may have elevated levels of chronic inflammation, as obesity is associated with chronic inflammation which can play a role in various diseases. However, specific inflammation levels can only be determined through medical tests measuring markers like C-reactive protein (hsCRP). 
Your light physical activity (2 times per week) may not be providing optimal anti-inflammatory benefits. Regular physical activity can help reduce inflammation by decreasing visceral fat mass and creating an anti-inflammatory environment. Increasing your physical activity could help improve your inflammatory status. 
It's worth noting that both excess body fat and lack of fitness can contribute to systemic inflammatory status. To accurately assess your inflammation levels, you would need proper medical testing, as inflammation markers can vary significantly between individuals and can be influenced by multiple factors.
